The claim is attributed to Graeme Zielin: spokesman for the Democratic Party of Wisconsin, who tweeted the statement on March 8, 2012.
The tweet was presented as a retweet fro: WisGOP) account, but it was later revealed that the state GOP never tweeted it.
Zielinski admitted to fabricating the tw: stating that he was "Tweeting" as the Wisconsin Republican Party to make a point about their stance on equal pay and women's healthcare.
The fact: checker previously examined a related claim about a bill on equal pay, finding that the legislation in question did not ensure pay equity but rather focused on workers' rights to sue for discrimination-related damages.
